Getting "Not enough memory resources are available to complete this operation" while creating a Runspace with System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.RunspaceFactory.CreateRunspace. This error happens only in one of the environments. 

<!--



System.TypeInitializationException: The type initializer for 'System.Management.Automation.Tracing.PSEtwLog' threw an exception. ---> System.TypeInitializationException: The type initializer for 'System.Management.Automation.Tracing.PSEtwLogProvider' threw an exception. ---> System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception: Not enough memory resources are available to complete this operation
   at System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.EtwRegister()
   at System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider..ctor(Guid providerGuid)
   at System.Management.Automation.Tracing.PSEtwLogProvider..cctor()
   --- End of inner exception stack trace ---
   at System.Management.Automation.Tracing.PSEtwLogProvider..ctor()
   at System.Management.Automation.Tracing.PSEtwLog..cctor()
   --- End of inner exception stack trace ---

Server stack trace: 
   at System.Management.Automation.RemoteRunspace..ctor(TypeTable typeTable, RunspaceConnectionInfo connectionInfo, PSHost host, PSPrimitiveDictionary applicationArguments, String name, Int32 id)
   at System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.RunspaceFactory.CreateRunspace(RunspaceConnectionInfo connectionInfo, PSHost host, TypeTable typeTable, PSPrimitiveDictionary applicationArguments, String name)

-->

## Steps to reproduce

``` 
call System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.RunspaceFactory.CreateRunspace(RunspaceConnectionInfo connectionInfo, PSHost host, TypeTable typeTable, PSPrimitiveDictionary applicationArguments, String name)
```

## Expected behavior

``` 
The runspace should not throw memory exception

```

## Actual behavior

```
Works for some time and then it throws the memory error.
```

## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```
.Net Version: 4.7
PSVersion: 5.1.17763.1490

The Memory usage at the time of the error is 1.2 GB. 

```

Any idea or suggestion to solve this issue is appreciated.

body:
<!-- Anything that looks like this is a comment and can't be seen after the Pull Request is created. -->

# PR Summary

On older Windows systems that don't support VT, they will get VT escape sequences if they enable certain ExperimentalFeatures that rely on VT.  Change to check if VT is supported before emitting.  In the case of Progress, we can't check deep in the Progress code as the host isn't available and it doesn't seem to make sense to pass it all the way down just for this.  Instead, we check in the consolehost and change to `Classic` progress view if VT is not supported.

I also noticed that the OSCIndicator code wasn't properly protected against older systems that don't support VT, so added that.

## PR Context

Fix https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/15047

body:
hi Guys !!

yes its crazy but the idea is like a framework its use _Dynamic AST keyword_ , string manipulation and the _event-typing_:
```

PS C:\> $ExecutionContext.SessionState.InvokeCommand.CommandNotFoundAction
PS C:\> $ExecutionContext.SessionState.InvokeCommand.PreCommandLookupAction
PS C:\> $ExecutionContext.SessionState.InvokeCommand.PostCommandLookupAction
PS C:\> $ExecutionContext.SessionState.InvokeCommand.LocationChangedAction

```
create a json file with predefined keyword (json schema maybe ?) keyword like: MetaKeyword (the name of the new keyword) , MetaArguments (the arguments of MetaKeyword with type if necessarly), String (the string expanded by the macro MetaKeyword), Code ( in json key: the code typed by the user and in there value: the code transformation) 
for example with simple example  `'unless ($condition) { $body }': 'if (!($condition)) { $body }'` in this example i use $condition and $body its a special variable to determine an unspecified code.

then we use the new pre-processor Cmdlet `Expand-PSLanguage -JsonFile $json` 

this feature will add more meta programming within PS
